newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine sets new rules for strategic investors.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine sets new rules for strategic investors.

text.p: Ukraine's State Property Fund has established new rules for strategic investors in the privatisation of 208 enterprises, its chief said on Thursday.

Parliament last month abruptly halted the privatisation of the 208 medium-sized and large enterprises, designated by the government to be made available for strategic investment, until rules were drawn up to halt corruption.

"We will continue putting the enterprises out to tender, having implemented new rules for the process," Yuri Yekhanurov, the head of the state privatisation agency (FDM), told an investment conference.
"The Fund is continuing with its strategy to attract strategic investors in these enterprises," he said.
Yekhanurov did not say what rule changes had been made.
Parliament has said it will allow the privatisation process to continue once it is satisfied with the rules.

The government has stated that its goal in 1997 is to increase foreign investment through privatisation. Foreign investment has reached about $1.2 billion in the five years since Ukraine won independence former the Soviet Union.
